title: Unable to immediately restart a Silo after entire cluster shuts down unexpectedly.
body:
Hey there,

As noted in the title, it appears that we are unable to restart a Silo after the entire cluster dies unexpectedly.

To replicate this issue, we have two Silos running together on the same machine. 
One is using Port 22222 and Proxy Port 40000 (Silo A), the other Port 22223 and Proxy Port 40001 (Silo B). 
After them running for a period of time (the length of which doesn't seem to matter), we close both of them together.
At this point the OrleansMembershipTable displays both Silos as Active (3) due to nothing being able to update this.
We then restart the Silo A.
This then takes 5 minutes (almost exactly) before failing to initialize the Silo.
It then reports that Silo A became unavailable for messaging.

Upon inspecting the OrleansMembershipTable at this point, we can see that Silo A has had its status changed to 'Joining' (2).

After this, starting Silo A or B is fine, regardless of their current status in the OrleansMembershipTable.

Through some investigation, we've managed to determine that the issue is in SiloHost.StartOrleansSilo();

What we're wanting to know is if there is any way around this issue.

Thank you

comments.body:
This is by design. Silo A is waiting for silo B to respond. One workaround is to start both silos . Another workaround is to wipe the table before you restart.
There is also a way to shorten the wait period, so silo a will wait less time for b. I will add a details of the config parameter to do that later.

---

The third and easiest option is to set orleansConfig.Globals.ValidateInitialConnectivity to false. 

That will completely disable the check in A of B. A will start OK and will just ignore this old entry of B saying Active.
Once B will start, it will mark its own old entry in the table as Dead and write a new entry and will be OK.

Initial impressions seem to be that this worked!

Thank you.

satisfaction_conditions: Solution must allow immediate silo restart after cluster-wide failure without 5-minute timeout
Must handle stale Active status entries in membership table after unexpected shutdown
Should provide mechanism to bypass connectivity validation with failed nodes
Must maintain cluster stability after subsequent restarts
Should avoid requiring manual table cleanup

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue
